<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>[[Image:bellcurve.jpg|right|200px]] Random real (floating point) value from 0 (inclusive) to x (not inclusive).<br>
<br>
Since Arma 3 v1.55.133393 alternative syntax is added, allowing the definition of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution Gaussian Distribution]<ext><name>ref</name><attr/><inner>Technically, it is a rescaled [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bates_distribution Bates distribution] with n = 4. The distribution is split in two at its midpoint and scaled linearly such that its maximum lies at the specified midpoint.</inner><close></ref></close></ext> params. Uses the same method as [[setTriggerTimeout]] command. Quite useful for spawning loot for example, making more valuable items more rare ('''Alternative Syntax 1''')<br><br>
Since Arma 3 v1.67.139663 two alternative syntaxes are available:
* allowing to generate semi-random number based on provided seed ('''Alternative Syntax 2''')
* generating pseudo-random [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlin_noise noise texture] based on provided seed and returning a single number between 0 (included) and 1 (excluded) at supplied ''x'' and ''y'' coordinates ('''Alternative Syntax 3''') </value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[random]] x </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> x: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[random]] [min, mid, max] <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55.133393</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Syntax 2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [min, mid, max]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 21</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> min: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 22</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> mid: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 23</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> max: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 24</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Number]]</value></part><part><name>Return value 2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> seed [[random]] x <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67.139663</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Syntax 3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p41</name>=<value> seed: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 41</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p42</name>=<value> x: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 42</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value> [[Number]] - value from 0 to x </value></part><part><name>Return value 3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s4</name>=<value> seed [[random]] [x, y] <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67.139663</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>Syntax 4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p61</name>=<value> seed: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 61</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p62</name>=<value> [x, y]: [[Array]] position on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlin_noise Perlin noise texture] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 62</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p63</name>=<value> x: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 63</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p64</name>=<value> y: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 64</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>r4</name>=<value> [[Number]] - value from 0 to 1 </value></part><part><name>Return value 4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_rNumber = [[random]] 1;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_rNumber = [[random]] -10;</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Generate a random position inside a circle (see also [[Example Code: Random Area Distribution]])
<code>_center [[getPos]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>_radius * [[sqrt]] [[random]] 1, [[random]] 360];</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> To select random value from an array:
<code>_array = ["apples", "pears", "bananas", "M16"];
_random = _array [[select]] [[floor]] [[random]] [[count]] _array;
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value><template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55.133393</value></part></template></value></part></template>
_random = [[selectRandom]] _array;</code>  </value></part><part><name>Example 4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 12, 2015 - 20:32 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Hcpookie|Hcpookie]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Random selections including negative numbers can be obtained via:

<code>_Xrnd = round(random 200) -100;</code>
This will yield numbers between -100 and 100.
* Be careful using random numbers in multiplayer, each client will come up with a different result. See multiplayer tutorials for more general information about locality. 
* The number returned is unlikely to be a whole number.<br>
To return a whole number use either '''[[round]]''', '''[[ceil]]''' or '''[[floor]]''' together with [[random]]:
<code>x = round(random 5) will return 0,1,2,3,4 or 5. (non-uniform distribution, 0 and 5 are half as likely to be selected than any of the other numbers)
x = floor(random 5) will return 0,1,2,3 or 4.   (uniform distribution, all numbers have the same probability of being selected)
x = ceil(random 5) will return  0,1,2,3,4 or 5. (0 is very unlikely, but possible, as ceil 0 is 0)</code>
</dd>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 22, 2018 - 12:58 (UTC+2)</dd>
